frameDefinitions: An Agent succeeds or fails to interact perceptually or physically with the Target or Target_location.

This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a  Judge decides whether the Accused should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be.  '' 'Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 bail until June 18.'
An Agent removes a Theme from a Source so that the it is in the Agent's possession.
A Claimant asserts his or her right to possession of a piece of Property (either real, such as land, or private).
In the Appeal stage of the criminal process the Convict or his or her Representative applies to a higher Court to reverse the Decision of the lower court on certain Grounds. '
In this frame a Speaker asks an Addressee for something, or to carry out some action.
frameExamples: At first he shot very <t>wide</t> of his target .
Thorsen, of Grimstad, Norway, was granted $100,000 <t>bail</t> until June 18.
Milton <t>took</t> the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
The King <t>claims</t> this land and surrounding waters.
The defense plans to <t>appeal</t> the court's decision on the grounds that the judge violated Code 81.b .
listRoleDefinitions: The individual who tries to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
The <fen>Target</fen> is the entity located in an indirectly accessible location relative to the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The object manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
The location that the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to access using the <fen>Instrument</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when something hits or misses.
The place where the <fen>Agent</fen> manages or fails to interact with the <fen>Target</fen>.
At the time of bail setting, the <fen>Accused</fen> is held without bail/bond, released on his/her own recognizance, or required to give the Court  a specific amount of money for bail.
The <fen>Judge</fen>, as head of  the Court, determines the <fen>Accused</fen>'s bail.
<fen>Status</fen> idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail.  The possible statuses are 'without bail/bond', 'on one's own recognizance', or a specific amount of money required for bail.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bail setting occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bail setting occurs.
The person who takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location of the <fen>Theme</fen> prior to the taking.
When the taking takes place.
Where the taking takes place.
The Claimant asserts rights or priviliges, typically ownership, over some Property.
The <fen>Property</fen> is declared to be under the ownership of the <fen>Claimant</fen>.
The <fen>Convict</fen> is the individual convicted of the crime who may make an appeal on her or his behalf.
The <fen>Representative</fen> applies to a higher court on behalf of the <fen>Convict</fen>.
The <fen>Decision</fen> is the ruling handed down by the first court.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which a <fen>Convict</fen> or <fen>Representative</fen> appeals.
The <fen>Speaker</fen>, as in other communication frames, is generally an External Argument.
In this frame the <fen>Addressee</fen> can either occur as an NP Object (usually with a following complement clause) or as a PP Complement of verbs or nouns.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the content of the request that can be expressed as a quote, in a finite or non-finite clausal Complement, an NP Object or PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>. The <fen>Medium</fen> is frequently expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>on</ment> or <ment>in</ment>.
The interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes the request.
listRoleExamples: Judge Duncan fixed <fex>the doctor's</fex> bail at one million dollars.
<fex>Judge Duncan</fex> fixed the doctor's bail at one million dollars.
Judge Duncan fixed the doctor's bail <fex>at one million dollars</fex>.
<fex>Milton</fex> took the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
Milton took <fex>the can of beer</fex> out of the refrigerator.
Milton took the can of beer <fex>out of the refrigerator</fex>.
The government seizure of a suspected dissident's computer <fex>last November</fex> has increased the tension between citizens and law enforcement.
Police seized several tons of marijuana <fex>in Berkeley</fex> last weekend.
The king ordered <fex>the envoy</fex> to claim the land accross the river.
I claim <fex>this forest and environs</fex> in the name of the Queen.
<fex>The judge</fex> ordered the plaintiff to return the money.
The child implored <fex>her parents</fex> to let her stay up late.
The parents of the missing child made an appeal <fex>on television</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Section 4 of the Donation Claims Act
the Willamette Stone State Heritage Site
the Office of Surveyor-General of Public Lands
